meanings.sent1: The little dog outbarks all the others in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The enthusiastic puppy outbarks its siblings during playtime.
meanings.sent3: The tiny chihuahua outbarks the big husky, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: The alarm system outbarks any intruder with its loud sirens.
meanings.sent5: The competitive terrier always outbarks the other dogs in the park.

meanings.definition: To bark louder or more frequently than others.
meanings.sent1: The neighbor's dog outbarks all the dogs on the street every morning.
meanings.sent2: The excited beagle outbarks whenever it sees a squirrel in the yard.
meanings.sent3: The little pug outbarks the big mastiff, creating a comical scene.
meanings.sent4: The thunder outbarks the howling wind during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The persistent hound outbarks until its owner finally takes it for a walk.
